title: CBC Life
text:
Finding the perfect art for your walls can be a challenge. Frames, prints, and paintings often require a lot of measuring, shopping around, and a mini identity crisis ("Does this black and white city skyline really reflect my soul?"). But what if your perfect masterpiece was already in your cupboards? Steven Sabados shows us how to repurpose woven baskets and mixing bowls into trendy and unique wall art. With just some paint, glue, and cheesecloth, you can keep adding to your DIY basket wall whenever you're inspired by a new pattern or texture.

Steven Sabados shows us how to create this unique cluster of baskets perfect for any wall in your home. 6:32

Here's what you'll need to follow along:

Woven baskets, mixing bowls, or baking pans of various sizes

Gesso or white paint

Black acrylic paint

Brown acrylic paint

Découpage glue

White primer spray paint

Cheesecloth

Paint brushes of various sizes

Scissors

Utility blade

Be sure to share your finished woven basket and bowl decor with us on our Facebook page.
description: Raid your cupboards to recreate this fall decor trend.
